page.title: 11PAGE 10 CONTINUED.
page.content: The farming in the study area is highly mechanised.Most of the farms have a small percentage of their land set by to grow root crops to feed their animals.The main problem with farming on the Fylde Coast is caused by the low_lying land that is often flooded,and therefore marshy,so large amounts of money,some from the { {E.E.C.,}has to be spent draining the land artificially. Lodge Farm consists of 80 acres,the land is mainly marsh and can be used for grazing cows.They grow wheat, barley and grass for silage.They breed pigs and have a few hens. The farm is run by the family,and they employ 1 man full_time,during the summer and autumn.They also employ casual labour.
